New Records: Jofra Archer was named Player of the Match for his brilliant bowling performance, taking 3 wickets for 23 runs in 4 overs, including a maiden over. Jason Roy and Jos Buttler set up the third highest first-wicket partnership for England against India in T20 internationals. Shreyas Iyer scored 67 off 48 balls, including 8 fours and a six, becoming the top scorer for India.
Key Match Events: England won the match by 8 wickets, chasing 130-2 in 15.3 overs. India scored 124-7 in 20 overs. Jofra Archer, Adil Rashid, Mark Wood, Ben Stokes, and Chris Jordan each took one wicket. India's best bowlers were Washington Sundar and Yuzvendra Chahal, each taking one wicket.
Post-Match Reflections: Jofra Archer was praised for his bowling performance, especially his maiden over which was crucial in the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a low-scoring game. The Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad was used for the match.
